context: Dell Technologies Inc. is a technology infrastructure company focused on PCs, servers, storage, and IT infrastructure solutions. Went private in 2013. Acquired EMC for $67B in 2015.

competitors.name: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE)
competitors.notes: Founded 2015 from HP split; major competitor in enterprise servers, storage, and infrastructure; historically sold with EMC gear

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Top competitor in enterprise storage and infrastructure alongside HPE and Cisco

competitors.name: Cisco
competitors.notes: Key competitor; was part of EMC-VMware VCE converged infrastructure partnership, affected by Dell-EMC deal

competitors.name: NetApp
competitors.notes: Major enterprise storage competitor with AI-driven data management solutions

competitors.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
competitors.notes: Dominant cloud IaaS competitor with 98.07% market share in cloud infrastructure category

competitors.name: Microsoft Azure
competitors.notes: Cloud infrastructure competitor with Azure Virtual Machines and storage offerings

competitors.name: Pure Storage
competitors.notes: Enterprise storage vendor with all-flash infrastructure solutions

competitors.name: Lenovo
competitors.notes: Competitor in servers and enterprise hardware

competitors.name: VMware
competitors.notes: Virtualization leader (became part of Dell Technologies through EMC acquisition)
